intro: Guarea selloana, commonly known as the "Cupuaçu tree," is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces a fruit that resembles a large, round cup, from which its common name is derived. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, making it of interest in traditional and modern pharmacology. Guarea selloana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
